III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth had a safety plan in place, and it was not followed.
Additional Allegations:
Youth reported being inappropriately touched by another youth
and staff did not do anything.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 1/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Courtesy Worker. Youth A reported
she was having a “bad day” on 12/31/2023. Youth A reported she
was not aware of being on a safety plan on 12/31/2023. Youth A
reported she was released from the hospital approximately a week
prior and had told “everyone” she was ready to leave the hospital
however Youth A reported she was not. Youth A was having
thoughts about how long she had been in residential placements
and was having a hard time. Youth A reported she left the house
and went outside for a walk down the hill without permission. A
staff, Youth A could not recall who, followed her and talked her
into going back into the house. Once back in the house Youth A
asked to talk to a staff, however no one came to talk to her. Youth
A did not recall which staff she asked to get someone for her to
talk to. Youth A went into the kitchen and took a pair of scissors
off the counter and put them in her pocket and went to the
bathroom. Youth A reported Youth B came in the bathroom and
saw blood on the floor. Youth A reported she was in one of the
bathroom stalls using the scissors to self-harm on her arm. Youth
B left the bathroom and got staff who came in and took the
scissors from Youth A and cleaned her cuts. Youth A talked to
Staff 2 on the telephone and left the house for a little while with
2

Staff 5. Staff 2 came into the facility and got Youth A from Staff 5.
Youth A reported she told Staff 2 she needed to go to the hospital
and can’t stay at the facility anymore. Staff 2 told Youth A it was
determined she did not need to go to the hospital. Youth A
reported she was upset. Once back at the house with Staff 2,
Youth A asked to be alone in her bedroom. Staff 2 informed
Youth A that she could not be alone in her room at this time.
Youth A became more upset that she could not be alone and
thought about a lighter she had stolen from the Dollar General
store the first month she was at the facility. Youth A reported she
had made a hole in her mattress and hide the lighter in the
mattress. Youth A reported she thought if she burned the house
down then she would not have to live at the facility anymore.
Youth A asked Staff 2 if she could change her clothes. Youth A
went into her bedroom and closed the door to act like she was
changing clothes and lit a shirt on fire however it was not burning
well. Youth A saw the tag on her comforter and lit it on fire. Youth
A reported the fire alarms started going off in the house. Staff,
unable to recall which staff, came into her bedroom and took the
lighter out of her hand as Youth A was using the lighter to burn her
arm. Youth A then ran out of the house.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported on 12/31/2023 she went to use the bathroom and Youth
A was in the bathroom and there was blood on the floor. Youth B
told Staff 6 she saw blood on the bathroom floor. Staff 6 told
Youth B to check on Youth A. Youth B went back into the
bathroom and looked under the bathroom stall and saw Youth A
self-harming with scissors. Youth B went out of the bathroom and
got Staff 4. Staff 6 went into the bathroom and took the scissors
away from Youth A. Staff 4 and Staff 6 were helping clean up the
cuts and bandage Youth A’s arm. Staff 5 was called to assist and
bring additional bandages. Youth B reported the scissors were on
the counter in the kitchen from an activity that was done earlier in
the day and Youth A took the scissors without anyone knowing.
Youth B reported Youth A left the house for a little while. Youth A
came back to the house and went into her bedroom and shut the
door. Staff were trying to figure out a plan for Youth A. Youth B
reported she did not recall which staff were there other than Staff
2. Youth A started a fire in her bedroom by lighting a blanket on
fire and the fire alarms in the house started going off. Youth A
was trying to jump into the fire and was using a lighter to try to
burn herself. Staff took the lighter away from Youth A and got her
away from the fire and put the fire out. Youth A then ran out of the
house and Staff 2 followed her. Youth B reported Youth A has not
3

returned to the house since. Youth B reported she did not know
when or where Youth A got the lighter.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 1/17/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 was the on-call
supervisor or 12/31/2023. Youth A had self-harmed earlier in the
day as he was informed by staff Youth A had gone into the
bathroom with scissors and cut her arm. Staff 1 was having
regular communication with the staff working with Youth A and
was doing check-ins to stay aware of the situation. Staff 1
reported approximately 30 minutes after Youth A self-harmed he
was informed Youth A lit something on fire in the house and ran
out of the house. Staff 2 was with Youth A at the house when
Youth A started the fire and Staff 2 was able to put the fire out and
then followed Youth A. Staff 2 called Administrator 1 and
Administrator 1 called Staff 1 to notify him of the fire and Youth A
running out of the house.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 was
on-call on 12/31/2023. Staff 2 was contacted about Youth A self-
harming. Staff 2 attempted to safety plan with Youth A via
telephone however Youth A would not safety plan with Staff 2.
Staff 2 directed Staff 4 via telephone to put Youth A on a safety
plan consisting of ten-minute checks and taking all items out of
Youth A’s bedroom to ensure safety. Staff 2 came into the facility
to meet with Youth A to safety plan face-to-face. Staff 2 was in
the house with Youth A. Youth A got a shirt and said she was
going to her bedroom to change. Staff 2 was giving Youth A two
minutes to change her clothes. Prior to the two minutes being up,
the fire alarm started going off in the house. Staff 2 went into
Youth A’s bedroom and saw Youth A’s comforter on fire and
Youth A burning her scars on her arm with a lighter. Staff 2 called
for Staff 4 or Staff 6 to get the fire extinguisher. Staff 2 got the
lighter from Youth A and Staff 4 and Staff 6 put the fire out. Youth
A ran out of the bedroom and out of the house. Staff 2 followed
Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4
reported Youth A had returned from being hospitalized a few days
prior to the incident on 12/31/2023. Youth A had been on a safety
plan after returning from the hospital on 12/27/2023 however was
taken off the safety plan on 12/29/2023. Staff 4 was downstairs
with two youth and Staff 6 was upstairs with Youth A and Youth B.
Youth A was no longer on a safety plan on 12/31/2023. Youth A
4

had scissors during the day as she had been cutting out tattoos.
Youth A went into the bathroom, and it was unknown she had
scissors with her in the bathroom. Staff 4 received a text
message from Staff 6 asking her to come upstairs. Staff 6 heard
Youth B found Youth A in the bathroom self-harming with scissors.
Youth A’s cuts were not deep, and staff assisted Youth A in
cleaning and bandaging the cuts. The on-call supervisor was
called however did not respond to the house. Staff 5 was called
over to assist due to concerns of Youth A’s self-harm behavior.
Staff 5 bandaged Youth A’s cuts and took Youth A out of the
house for a little awhile. While Youth A was out of the house,
Staff 4 and Staff 6 moved items that could be used for self-harm
as a precautionary for Youth A returning to the house. Youth A
was making statements that she had a plan, and she was going to
kill everyone. Youth A would not disclose her plan. Staff 2 was
the on-call therapist and was contacted. Youth A was put on a
safety plan after self-harming with scissors that included ten-
minute checks. Staff 2 came to the house. Staff 2 was with Youth
A when Youth A returned to the house. Youth A was pacing in the
house and Staff 2 was following Youth A. Youth A’s bedroom had
been cleared and there was only Youth A’s comforter, pillow and
possibly a few other things. Youth A went into her bedroom for
less than a minute and the smoke detector started going off in the
house. Staff 2 went into Youth A’s bedroom and Staff 4 saw
smoke. Staff 2 grabbed a lighter from Youth A’s hand and Staff 6
grabbed a fire extinguisher. Staff 2 used the fire extinguisher to
put out the fire. Youth A attempted to jump into the fire and Staff 6
blocked Youth A. Youth A ran out of the bedroom and out of the
house. Staff 2 followed Youth A. Staff 4 did not see Youth A
again that night. Staff 4 did not know where Youth A obtained a
lighter from.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams meeting on 1/17/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 was called to assist
Youth A in cleaning up the self-harm wounds on her arm and
wrapping Youth A’s arm. Staff 5 reported Youth A’s self-harm
cuts from the scissors did not seem deep and did not require
additional medical attention. While Staff 5 was cleaning up Youth
A’s wounds, Youth A was making statement that she was going to
kill herself. After Youth A’s arm was bandaged, Youth A went
outside, and Staff 5 went outside to talk to her. Youth A was
having a difficult time being at Sherk House, so Staff 5 took Youth
A to Ashmun House with her for a little while. Youth A was with
Staff 5 for about an hour to hour and a half. At Ashmun House,
Youth A watched a movie with Staff 5. Staff 5 reported Youth A
appeared to be regulated. Staff 2 came to Ashmun House and
5

took Youth A back to Sherk House. This was the only interaction
Staff 5 had with Youth A. Youth A did not disclose she had a
lighter to Staff 5. Staff 5 had no knowledge of Youth A having a
lighter.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 1/24/2024. Staff 6
worked second shift with Staff 4 on 12/31/2023. Staff 6 reported
Youth A was not on a safety plan at the beginning of the shift.
Youth A had received fake tattoos for Christmas and had scissors
to cut out the tattoos. During the shift Youth A became upset over
the TV. Youth A got scissors and went into the bathroom without
staff being aware. Staff 6 did not know where Youth A got the
scissors from as it was after Youth A had been cutting out her
tattoos. Youth B went into the bathroom and saw blood on the
floor and got Staff 4. Staff 6 went into the bathroom and took the
scissors out of Youth A’s hands. Another staff, unable to recall
which staff, came over and assisted Youth A in cleaning up the
cuts on her arm and took Youth A out of the house for a little
while. Staff 6 reported Youth A was making self-harming
statements including threatening to put oil in the oven to blow up
the house. While Youth A was out of the house with the other
staff, Staff 4 and Staff 6 took safety precautions in the house of
putting items in secure locations to ensure Youth A did not have
access to self-harm including cleaning out Youth A’s bedroom and
only leaving her pillow and comforter in her bedroom. Staff 6
reported on-call was notified and Youth A was placed on a safety
plan that included close observation. Youth A returned to the
house and went to the closet in the house where her clothes were
being kept and got a shirt. Youth A went to her bedroom to
change and within a minute or two of Youth A being in her
bedroom the fire alarm began going off. Staff 6 reported upon
opening Youth A’s bedroom door, Youth A had lit her comforter
and shirt on fire and was attempting to burn herself. Staff 6 got
the fire extinguisher while staff went in and took the lighter from
Youth A and were putting out the fire. Youth A ran out of the
house and went AWOL. Staff 6 remained at the house and did
not have any information after Youth A ran out of the house. Staff
6 did not know where Youth A obtained a lighter from.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist
heard about Youth A’s incident on 12/31/2023 however was not
present during the incident. Therapist had worked with Youth A
following Youth A being discharged from Forestview Hospital.
Therapist met with Youth A on 12/27/2023, 12/28/2023, and
12/29/2023. Therapist reported she felt Youth A was doing well
6

and felt she was stable and took her off the safety plan that was
put in place on 12/27/2023. Therapist reported Youth A’s
belongings are a “safety blanket” to her and she felt Youth A was
in a good place to be able to have her items back as Youth A was
engaged in therapy session with her and was taking accountability
for her actions.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
1 reported Youth A was not on a safety plan when Youth A self-
harmed with scissors. Youth A had come off the safety plan on
12/29/2023. Administrator 1 reported Staff 2 called her to discuss
being notified of Youth A self-harming with scissors and Staff 2
placing Youth A on a safety plan. Administrator 1 suggested Staff
2 go on campus to try to safety plan with Youth A face-to-face
which Staff 2 did. Administrator 1 was at the facility as she was
planning on assisting with taking Youth A to the hospital for an
evaluation due to the self-harming with scissors and then the fire
in the house.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 1/10/2023 and
reported no further concerns.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A progress note dated 12/28/2023 completed by
Psychiatrist: Youth A was recently hospitalized at
Forestview hospital due to concerns of being suicidal.
Youth A was discharged and returned to Eagle Village.
Youth A reported having suicidal ideations but denied plan
and denied having current suicidal ideations. Youth A
reported current medications are helpful. Youth A was
cooperative with good eye contact during session, showed
no signs of abnormal involuntary movements, mood
appeared “good”, thoughts were organized, and goal
directed, denied the presence of suicidal, homicidal
ideations intent or plans, and denied hallucinations.
Recommendations include continue residential treatment
plan, regular follow up with primary care provider, no
access to weapons, supervision with medication, follow up
in 3-4 weeks with Psychiatrist or sooner if worsening
symptoms.
• Eagle Villate Safety Plan for Youth A dated 12/27/2023
completed by Staff 2: Youth A returned from Forestview
Psychiatric Hospital on 12/27/2023 and is being placed on
a safety plan to transition back into the facility from
7

hospitalization due to suicidal ideations. The following is
the safety plan: All items will be removed from the youth's
room, except for a pillow, sheets, and comforter,
immediately upon being placed on a safety plan. Youth A is
allowed to have one comfort item like a stuffed animal and
one book. Bedroom door is to remain open at all times.
Youth A should remain in staff eyesight and close proximity
to staff (with exception to private/sleeping times) will only
use their bedrooms to sleep. Youth A should be
encouraged to participate in all program activities. Youth A
should have a designated staff to observe them during the
program activities. Staff will accompany Youth A to the
bathroom. Staff will "pocket check" Youth A before entering
the bathroom. Staff will check the bathroom for any
potential objects that could be used to inflict harm. When
using the bathroom or shower, the staff will check on Youth
A every two minutes. Staff will initiate conversation or ask
the youth a question through the door. If Youth A does not
respond, staff will enter the bathroom to ensure Youth A is
safe. At quiet time and bedtime, a staff will be present in
the hallway with the focus on directly supervising Youth A,
until she falls asleep, with the door open. If further
issues/concerns arise with Youth A, the on-call therapist
will be contacted again.
• Email documentation from Therapist to Sherk House staff
dated 12/29/2023 at 3:07pm: Youth A is taken off her safety
plan and ten-minute checks.
• Eagle Villate Incident Report dated 12/31/2023: Staff 2 was
notified Youth A had self-harmed with scissors in the
bathroom. Youth A spoke with Staff 2 via telephone
however was unable to safety plan. Staff 2 went to the
facility to safety plan with Youth A, Youth A made several
comments about how she was going to kill herself and she
had a plan. Youth A was placed on a safety plan with 10-
minute checks. Youth A went into her bedroom and closed
her bedroom door. Youth A informed Staff 2 she was
changing clothes in her bedroom. Staff 2 gave Youth A 2
minutes to change. The fire alarm began going off at the 2-
minute mark. Staff 2 opened Youth A's bedroom door and
found the corner of Youth A’s comforter was on fire and a
shirt on the floor next to the comforter was on fire. Youth A
was using a lighter to burn her self-harm cuts. The fire was
8

put out with a fire extinguisher and Youth A ran out of the
house.
Additional Allegations:
Interviews:
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported Youth C “sexually assaulted me and staff didn’t do
anything about it”. Youth B reported she did not recall when the
incident happened but thought it was around summertime. Youth
B reported Youth C slapped her “ass” and put his hand in her
pants. Youth B reported it happened in the school building in
Holbrook. Youth B did not recall what specific staff she talked to
about the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported she was Youth B’s case manager prior to recently
becoming a therapist at the facility. Staff 2 reported no knowledge
of Youth B alleging inappropriate touching by Youth C. Staff 2
reported if Youth B had made allegations to her about Youth C
inappropriately touching Youth B, she would have provided this
information to Therapist and Youth C’s case worker.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Therapist has
been Youth B’s therapist since Youth B arrived at the facility.
Youth B made statements to Therapist prior to summer break
about while Youth B was in the elementary classroom a male
youth, Therapist believed it was Youth C however could not recall,
had kissed her and tried to put his hands down her pants when
Youth B was at the desk. Therapist reported she told Supervisor
and Administrator 1. Therapist reported video footage was
reviewed and there was no video footage found to support the
allegations were true. Therapist added a section in Youth B’s
behavior support plan to address this. Therapist reported Youth B
never reported Youth C slapped her butt to her.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
recalled an incident approximately seven months ago with a male
peer and Youth B however it was not Youth C. Supervisor
reported Youth B alleged a male peer “molested” her. Supervisor
reported video footage in the classroom was reviewed by a
supervisor that no longer works at the facility and there was not
video found to show the incident occurred. Youth B’s caseworker
9

was informed of the allegations Youth B made. Youth B’s
caseworker reported Youth B has a pattern of making false
allegations. Supervisor had no knowledge of Youth B reporting
Youth C put his hand down her pants or slapped her butt.
Principal was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Principal
reported she did not recall any incidents where Youth B alleged
another youth slapping her butt or putting their hands down Youth
B’s pants during school. Principal looked at Powerschool where it
is documented any concerns or incidents that happen in school in
the log entries. Principal did not find any documented incidents
regarding the allegations. Principal found other log entries
regarding Youth B and Youth B’s boundaries with male peers.
Principal reported there is always a teacher, para-pro aide present
in the classroom. Youth are separated in the classroom by sex as
there is a table to keep the male peers separated from the female
peers.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
1 reported if an incident occurs at the school with youth that the
school addresses the issue. Administrator 1 reported with the
timeframe around summertime that the facility wouldn’t have been
able to review the video as the facility recently updated the
camera system. Administrator 1 could not recall any allegations
being made to her regarding Youth B alleging Youth C slapped
her butt or put his hands down her pants.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator 2
did not know any information about Youth B’s allegation.
Administrator 2 had heard Youth B and Youth C were dating at
one point but had not further information about any incidents
occurring between the two youth. Administrator 2 reported youth
at the facility are only in the school building during school hours.
Administrator 2 reported if an incident occurs at school, then the
school is responsible for completing the incident report.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Behavior Support Plan for Youth B dated
6/22/2023 and then updated on 7/16/2023, 8/7/2023,
9/23/2023: Youth B is never to be alone with another youth.
Staff should be within ear shot to know if the topic is
appropriate and redirect if needed. Youth B is to be in
staff’s eyesight at all times when outside. In school Youth
10

B is to sit in a seat that is not close to her other peers.
When Youth B needs to get up from her seat it should be
when others are seated, thus there is no confusion about
someone “touching her”.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A was not on a safety
plan prior to self-harming on 12/31/2023. After Youth A self-
harmed, a safety plan was put in place to complete more frequent
checks on Youth A and her bedroom was cleared of items to
prevent self-harm. It was unknown Youth A had a lighter hid in
her mattress. Youth A went into her bedroom to change clothes at
which time staff allowed two minutes and Youth A started the fire
during that time.
Additional Allegations: The facility is found in compliance as
there was a Behavior Support Plan for Youth B addressing Youth
B not being alone with any other peers and to maintain Youth B in
staff’s eyesight at all times when outside. The alleged incident
occurred during school at the school building which would be the
schools responsibility to address.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member restrained youth resulting in bruises all over
youth’s body. The staff member used a level one restraint, and it
lasted forty-two minutes.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 1/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Courtesy Worker. Youth A reported
she ran out of the house after staff came in and put the fire out in
her bedroom. Youth A was running down 170th Ave. and Staff 2
was following her. Staff 1 drove down in the car and parked the
car down the road in front of Youth A and Staff 2. Youth A
reported Staff 1 “grabbed and restrained” her. Youth A reported
she received a bruise on the same arm she had self-harmed with
11

the scissors that day on her upper right bicep. Youth A reported
“it hurt really bad”. Youth A reported she also received a quarter
size bruise on her hand from the restraint as Staff 1 was
restraining her “really tight”. Youth A reported she begged Staff 1
to let her out of the restraint as it was really tight, and she said she
could not breath. Youth A told Staff 1 she was having an asthma
attack and requested her inhaler. Youth A reported she was
telling Staff 1 she “would be good” and Staff 1 told her no, he did
not trust her. Youth A reported she thought Staff 1 was going to
break her arm. Youth A described the restraint hold and
technique Staff 1 had Youth A in which was the benevolent
restraint. Staff 2 was present. Youth A was begging Staff 2 to
have Staff 1 let her go and Staff 2 stated “this is what you get for
running”. Youth A attempted to drop to the ground in the restraint
as she thought Staff 1 would release her however Staff 1
maintained his hold on her. Youth A reported she was forced to
walk back to the house in the restraint. Youth A reported Staff 3
assisted Staff 1 with the restraint towards the end. Youth A
reported Staff 1 had her right arm and Staff 3 secured her left arm
as they walked back to the house. Youth A denied making any
self-harm statements. Youth A reported the restraint hurt and it
was hard for her to breath. Youth A reported the restraint lasted
over an hour. Youth A did not have any other concerns about the
restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 1/17/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 assisted Staff 2 with
Youth A down 170th Ave. Staff 1 reported he drove down 170th
Ave. and Youth A and Staff 2 were almost to US 10. Staff 1
parked the car approximately ten yards in front of Youth A and
Staff 2. Staff 1 got out of the car and attempted to talk to Youth A
and redirect Youth A by informing Youth A she was getting too
close to US 10, and they needed to move away from US 10.
Youth A continued moving towards Staff 1 and US 10. Youth A
got approximately five yards from Staff 1. Staff 1 put his arm out
with his palm open to try to use proximity control however Youth A
tried to push past Staff 1 to continue towards US 10. Staff 1
placed Youth A in a benevolent restraint due to concern with
Youth A’s self-harming behaviors of cutting, starting a fire, and
then going towards US 10 as it was dark and there were several
cars traveling. Staff 2 was present with Staff 1 and maintained a
flashlight on Youth A and Staff 1 in the restraint. Youth A made
statements while in the restraint that her arm hurt. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 was in communication with Administrator 1 about
the restraint and was obtaining approval to continue the restraint
as it was going over the time limits. Youth A’s shirt was lifting
12

during the restraint and Staff 1 asked Staff 2 to call Staff 3 to
assist with the restraint. Staff 1 explained he requested Staff 3 to
come assist with the restraint as Staff 2 had previously been
unsuccessful in a restraint with Youth A and Staff 1 was
concerned about transitioning into a two-person restraint with Staff
2. Staff 3 arrived, assisted in fixing Youth A’s sweatshirt and
transitioned into a two-person level one restraint with Staff 1. Staff
1 reported Youth A was making statements that she wanted to kill
herself and wanted to go to the hospital as she did not feel she
was getting the help she needed at the facility. Staff 1 and Staff 3
walked Youth A back to the house in the two-person escort hold
while Staff 2 followed in the car. Administrator 1 arrived and
provided Staff 1 with a headlight for him to wear for more light on
the way back to the house as it was dark. Staff 1 reported he did
not release Youth A from the restraint until there was a plan which
was for Youth A to go to the hospital to be assessed. Staff 1
